titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the 1922 account book ARC.250
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:14:10 +0000.

did.abstract: One oversize bound volume used as an account book in relation to various services and necessities, including public utilities, equipment and supplies, construction, maintenance and repair, automobile parts, insurance, decoration, and others. All accounts in the volume date from 1922. The creator of the account book is not known, but an envelope filed toward the end of the volume suggests that it may have been used by Frank K. Lang of Middle Village, Long Island, N.Y.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); 1922 account book, ARC.250, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
